name: Xanthoxylum
Relationship: Compare: GNAPH.; CIMICIF.; STAPH.; MEZER.; PISCIDIA - White dogwood - (a nerve sedative. INSOMNIA DUE to worry, nervous excitement, spasmodic coughs; pains of irregular menstruation; regulates the flow. Neuralgic and spasmodic affections. Use tincture in rather material doses.)

Head: Pain over eyes, throbbing pressure over nose, pressure in forehead; head seems divided; ringing in ears
Weight and pain on vertex
Feels full
Sick headache with dizziness and flatulence
Occipital headache
Respiratory: Constant desire to take a long breath; oppression of chest
Abdomen: Dysentery, with tympanites, tenesmus; in-odorous discharges
Sleep: Hard and unrefreshing; dreams of flying
Female: Ovarian neuralgia, with pain in loins and lower abdomen; worse, left side, extending down the thigh, along genitocrural nerves
Neuralgic dysmenorrhoea, with neuralgic headaches; pain in back and down legs
Neurasthenic patients who are thin, emaciated; poor assimilation with insomnia and occipital headache
Extremities: Numbness of left side; impairment of nerve of motion
Pain in nape, extending down back
Paralysis of left side following spinal disorders
Neuralgic shooting pain, as from electricity, all over limbs

details: Its specific action is on the nervous system and mucous membranes. Paralysis, especially HEMIPLEGIA. Painful hemorrhages, after-pains, NEURALGIC DYSMENORRHOEA, and rheumatic affections, offer a therapeutic field for this remedy, especially in patients of spare habit and nervous, delicate organization. Indigestion from over-eating or from too much fluid. Sluggish capillary circulation. Neurasthenia, poor assimilation, insomnia, occipital headache. Increases mucous secretion of mouth and stimulates the secretion from all glands with ducts opening in the mouth.
